intro: Oenothera curtiflora, commonly known as the short-flowered evening primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Oenothera curtiflora is adapted to arid environments and is known for its nocturnal blooming pattern.
